summary.body: I saw that in today's CityAM paper that Wallside has been featured following the buyout of the lease from the Corporation of London (or whatever they are now) to freehold. According to some this adds 30K to this type of property. Mind you they have a valuation of between 1m and 1.2m
summary.subject: Leasehold

summary.body: OK, this is a bit belated, but I'm up to the August post now. In the September service charge statement, it says we got a Refund of Supervision and management Charges for the period 01/04/1999 to 31/03/2007. This amounts to 170 for our flat.  My question is this (for the more legally minded I expect): are we expected or required to pay the previous owners of the flat their share? For example, if we bought the flat on 01/04/2003, would the previous owner get 4 years of the refund (50%)? Or is it all mine?
summary.subject: Refund of Supervision and Management Charges

summary.body: Could I say a public 'thank you' to David Graves as Chairman of the Barbican Association fo the work he has done on the legal and practical processes around extending our leases. Clearly it's a matter for personal decision but the agreements he has been able to reach and the document now available are most helpful. Many thanks, Pennie
summary.subject: The Guide to Lease Extensions
